poem:
Title: In the Cradle of Care

In the stilled morn, 
with breast yearning to feed,
Mother, heart aching, learns
the language of loss. 
Tongue-tied babe, fragile, in need,
A melody, unheard, unravels 
Syntactic sound of suckling. 
A mother's lament, etched in silence,
In the dance of nurture and survival,
Mocked by medicine's cold, unyielding hand,
Life's rhythm falters.
Yet, love sustains.
